pageContext.associations: Found with a flat celt, with a fragment of cloth and hering, No. 1, and two flat triangular daggers, No. 25 and 26, with one fragment of a wooden sheath, a sandstone amulet, a fragment of a third dagger and cremated bones.
pageContext.site: England,Dorset,Upney (near),Barrow on Ridgeway (No. 7),Found in the fourth interment in Mr. John Mays's barrow on the Ridgeway, near Upney, opened August 1885.
pageContext.toSearch: The Ridgeway, Weymouth, Weymouth, Dorset Dt3, UK
pageContext.remarks: These ornaments are fragile, and so fixed that it was difficult to measure them with precision, but the drawings are substantially accurate.
